# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/tomli/_re.py
@source-hash: 75b8e0e428594f6d
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:16Z

## Purpose
Part of the `tomli` TOML parser library, this module provides regular expression patterns and parsing utilities for handling numeric and temporal values in TOML format according to the TOML specification.

## Key Components

### Regular Expression Patterns
- `_TIME_RE_STR` (L17): Raw string pattern for time format validation (HH:MM:SS with optional microseconds)
- `RE_NUMBER` (L19-37): Compiled regex for parsing TOML numbers including:
  - Hexadecimal (0x prefix)
  - Binary (0b prefix) 
  - Octal (0o prefix)
  - Decimal integers and floats with optional underscores, exponents
  - Named group `floatpart` for distinguishing integers from floats
- `RE_LOCALTIME` (L38): Compiled regex using `_TIME_RE_STR` for local time parsing
- `RE_DATETIME` (L39-49): Compiled regex for full datetime parsing including:
  - Date part (YYYY-MM-DD)
  - Optional time part with timezone offset or Zulu time indicator

### Parsing Functions
- `match_to_datetime(match)` (L52-84): Converts regex match to `datetime.datetime` or `datetime.date`
  - Returns `date` object if no time component present
  - Handles timezone parsing (UTC, offset, or local)
  - Processes microseconds with proper padding
- `cached_tz(hour_str, minute_str, sign_str)` (L87-95): LRU-cached timezone factory
  - Creates `timezone` objects from offset strings
  - Handles positive/negative offsets
- `match_to_localtime(match)` (L98-101): Converts time regex match to `time` object
- `match_to_number(match, parse_float)` (L104-107): Converts number regex match to appropriate numeric type
  - Uses `parse_float` callback for floating-point values
  - Uses `int(group, 0)` for automatic base detection of integers

## Dependencies
- Standard library: `datetime`, `functools.lru_cache`, `re`, `typing`
- Internal: `._types.ParseFloat` type alias

## Architecture Notes
- Uses verbose regex compilation with `re.VERBOSE` for readability
- Leverages LRU caching for timezone objects to avoid repeated creation
- Follows TOML specification for number formats including underscore separators
- Separates concerns between pattern matching and value construction
